directions: Preheat the oven to 190C/170C fan/gas 5. In a medium bowl, beat the butter and sugar together using an electric whisk until light and fluffy. Gradually whisk in the eggs.
In a separate bowl, combine the oats, flour and bicarbonate of soda. Season with salt, then gradually add the butter mixture, stirring well. Mix in the dried cranberries and white chocolate bits.
Spoon dollops of the mixture onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 10-12 minutes until golden brown. Cool on a wire rack.
Feeling inspired? Take a look at our cookie recipes.
ingredients: 150 g dried cranberries, such as Ocean Spray Craisins
title: Cranberry and white chocolate cookies
